meanings.definition: To remove a mask from someone's face.
meanings.sent1: She was unmasking the superhero at the costume party.
meanings.sent2: The magician unmasked himself at the end of the show.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried unmasking the family dog for fun.
meanings.sent4: The detective was unmasking the criminal's true intentions.
meanings.sent5: The sun slowly unmasked the beauty of the morning landscape.

meanings.definition: To reveal the true identity or nature of something or someone.
meanings.sent1: The investigation was unmasking the real culprit behind the crime.
meanings.sent2: The whistleblower unmasked the corruption within the company.
meanings.sent3: The surprise party was a clever way of unmasking the birthday person.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece unmasked the emotions hidden within.
meanings.sent5: The storm unmasked the vulnerability of the old house.
